``` {r basic analysis}

library(readr)
library(devtools)
library(blsAPI)
library(rjson)
library(curl)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
#Loads necessary packages

merged_final <- read_csv("csv files/mergedFinal.csv")

AR_base <- merged_final[ merged_final$state == "AR", ]

scatter.smooth(AR_base$year, AR_base$value, main="Unemployment by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Unemployment", col = "blue")

scatter.smooth(AR_base$year, AR_base$HPI, main="HPI by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "HPI", col = "blue")

scatter.smooth(x=AR_base$year, y=AR_base$value, main="Unemployment by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Unemployment", col = "red")

scatter.smooth(x=AR_base$year, y=AR_base$poverty, main="% of People Below Poverty Level", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Poverty", ylim = c(0,20))

AR_base$RMHI <- as.integer(AR_base$RMHI)
plot(x=AR_base$year, y=AR_base$RMHI, main="Median Household Income by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "RMHI" )
#ERROR: Unable to properly plot graph for MHI or population


AR_base$population <- as.integer(AR_base$population)
plot(x=AR_base$year, y=AR_base$population, main="Population by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Population" )
#ERROR: Unable to properly plot graph for MHI or population


#test to show a scatterplot CA HPI data against year
```
